required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of CS1-targeted CAR-T Cells Therapy for Relapsed Multiple Myeloma After BCMA CAR-T Cells Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial for the Safety and Efficacy of CS1-targeted CAR-T Cells Therapy for Relapsed Multiple Myeloma After BCMA CAR-T Cells Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical trial for the safety and efficacy of CS1-targeted CAR-T Cells therapy for relapsed multiple myeloma after BCMA CAR-T cells therapy

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single arm, open-label, single-center study. This study is indicated for relapsed CS1+ multiple myeloma, the selections of dose levels and the number of subjects are based on clinical trials of similar foreign products. 50 patients will be enrolled for this trial. Primary objective is to explore the safety, main consideration is dose-related safety.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days after CS1 targeted CAR T-cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events assessed according to NCI-CTCAE v5.0 criteria

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years after CS1 targeted CAR T-cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events [Safety and Tolerability]

secondary_outcome.description: Assessment using European Organisation for the Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30) scale [For item1-28: max score: 112, min score: 28, higher scores mean a better outcome; for item 28-29: max score: 14, min score: 2, higher scores mean a worse outcome] to measure Quality of life at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL) score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL) scale [max score: 56, min score: 14, higher scores mean a worse outcome] at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12
Assessment using Activities of Daily Living (ADL) scale (Barthel Index) [max score: 100, min score: 0, higher scores mean a better outcome] at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) score
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) score at Baseline, Month 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12

arm_group.arm_group_label: Administration of CS1 Targeted CAR T-cells
arm_group.description: Dose escalation follows the standard 3+3 dose escalation design. A total of 3 dose levels are set for subjects.

intervention.description: Each subject receive CS1 Targeted CAR T-cells by intravenous infusion
intervention.arm_group_label: Administration of CS1 Targeted CAR T-cells

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital，College of Medicine, Zhejiang University
